        Description copied from interface: InstallerCommand
        A command is given an instance of a Spring container, which is expected to be constructed based on the properties fed into the installer, and an Options instance that captures the options the user passed into the installer.

      • buildCommandsForDhs

        protected java.util.List<com.marklogic.appdeployer.command.Command> buildCommandsForDhs()
        In the spirit of whitelisting, we'll only setup the commands that we know we need for installing DHF. We may need a more broad set of commands for user files.

      • modifyHubConfigForDhs

      • buildDefaultProjectProperties

        protected java.util.Properties buildDefaultProjectProperties(Options options)
        Builds a default set of project properties based on assumptions of how DHS works. These can then be overridden via "-P" arguments on the command line.
        Parameters:
        options -
        Returns:

      • applyDhsSpecificProperties

        public void applyDhsSpecificProperties(java.util.Properties props)
        Public so that it can be reused by DHF Gradle plugin. Assumes that SSL should be used for connecting to MarkLogic.
        Parameters:
        props -

      • applyDhsSpecificProperties

        public void applyDhsSpecificProperties(java.util.Properties props,

      • setDefaultPropertiesForSecureConnections

        protected void setDefaultPropertiesForSecureConnections(java.util.Properties props)
        As of DHS 2.6.0, all connections to DHS require secure connections. This method then configures both ml-app-deployer and DHF properties to use secure connections. In addition, all DatabaseClient connections default to using basic security, again per DHF 2.6.0.
        Parameters:
        props -
